description: Kotarou was pretty much supposed to be your average boy, worried about the pressures of education while enjoying a simple life with his friends. Much to his despair, he one day finds the overly cheerful Misha at his door, asking to be friends out of nowhere. Even more shocking is that Misha is an apprentice angel, yet she does more bad then good. Along with Kotarou's school friends Takashi and Koboshi and the so called devil Shia (once again being able to do more good then bad), the group of friends spend their days getting into all sorts of adventures and troubles. Based on the manga by Koge-Donbo.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

__Height:__ 154 cm (5' 0")

[Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/sawashiro-miyuki.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miyuki_Sawashiro) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E6%B2%A2%E5%9F%8E%E3%81%BF%E3%82%86%E3%81%8D)

Began her voice-acting career in 1999 and has continued her work as a seiyuu for more than two decades. Her younger brother [Chiharu Sawashiro](https://anilist.co/staff/120159) is a fellow voice actor.

__Non-anime roles:__~!

• Twilight Sparkle in "My Little Pony: Friendship is Magic/Equestria Girls" (animated cartoon & movies)
• Makoto Makimura in "Yakuza 0/Kiwami 2" (VG)!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/koge_dobo) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/member.php?id=106417) | [Bluesky](https://bsky.app/profile/kogedobo.bsky.social)

In April 2008, Koge-Donbo changed her pen-name by adding an asterisk (`*`) at the end. She is now known as Koge-Donbo*.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/omodeakemi)

Funta is a duo consisting of vocalist/songwriter UCO (U子) and guitarist/keyboardist Yoshimi (吉見). The Funta "sound" can be characterized as having a strong pop rock sensibility with a tendency toward electronic elements and moe-pop vocals.
[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/たなかかずや)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/136171134)

A long-serving anime producer, as well as a founder of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/), [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/) and [Studio M2](https://anilist.co/studio/6137/). He currently serves as the Chairman of the Board at [Mappa](https://anilist.co/studio/569/).

Maruyama graduated from Hosei University in 1963, and soon after, he found work at [Mushi Production](https://anilist.co/studio/68/) in 1965. It was here that he met many of Madhouse's future staff members. In October 1972, he left Mushi Production together with [Rintarou](https://anilist.co/staff/102305/), [Osamu Dezaki](https://anilist.co/staff/100393/) and [Yoshiaki Kawajiri](https://anilist.co/staff/100812/) and founded Madhouse. From that time onward, Maruyama focused mainly on producing and planning Madhouse's upcoming projects. He also served as the studio's president through the '80s and '90s.

Thanks in large part to his frequent attendance at anime conventions, he has become well-known in America among Madhouse's fanbase. Not simply wanting to emulate past successes, Maruyama frequently says at these events that his goal as a producer is to seek out new challenges that will allow the production staff to keep experimenting. This attitude in part has been the reason why he has encouraged the studio to take on projects that may not seem like sure-fire commercial hits. In addition, Maruyama has long been a supporter of bringing new talents into the animation business, and continues to encourage young people to work in anime.

In 2011, he left Madhouse and founded Mappa. Later in 2016, he left Mappa and founded Studio M2.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Masumi Itou is a singer and composer. Ito has composed the soundtracks to many anime television shows and is part of the bands Oranges & Lemons and Heart of Air. She graduated from Musashino College of Music, and her husband is music producer Yoshiyuki Ito.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She joined [Magic Bus](https://anilist.co/studio/207/) after having graduated from from Yoyogi Animation Academy. She holds a pencil and colored pencil in the same hand simultaneously which allows her to draw shading immediately after drawing the linework.

Her real name is Kumiko Sakai, and she is occasionally mistaken for a man due to her pseudonym, which she has been credited with since 2000. She is also friends with [Seiya Numata](https://anilist.co/staff/124320/), and they often participate in the same productions. They're both big idol fans and their friendship sparked due to a conversation about Morning Musume, a girl group.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yasu1569) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yasu1569/)
Originally an animator. Often works with [Hijiri Sanpei](https://anilist.co/staff/149565/).
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/141121934) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/akemi_h_0808/) | [Blog](http://replica08.web.fc2.com/index.html)

[Official Website](https://bushiroad.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kidanit)

Takaaki Kidani is a Japanese businessman. He is the founder and president of Bushiroad. Kidani has also served as the chairman of New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW). He continues to be involved with NJPW through Bushiroad, in which owns the company.

He founded Bushiroad in May 2007 as a company that produces card games and assumed the position of president. The origin of the name Bushiroad comes from the failure to make Neppu Kairiku Bushi Road into a film due to various reasons when he led the project in the days of Broccoli. The film was restarted in March 2013 with Kidani as the executive producer. The company would create numerous media franchises including Tantei Opera Milky Holmes and BanG Dream!

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/381332122)

She was nicknamed "Yasuko Nyan" by her godfather Naomi Takebe, a producer at [Toei Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/18/Toei-Animation).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).
Affiliated with [ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/).

Kawashiro Kazumi is the president & CEO of Bandai Visual. He graduated from Sophia University - a private university in Japan famous for its international climate. In April of 1982, a month after graduation, he started working at Canyon Records. In July of 1989 he joined Bandai and in April of 1994 he was transferred to Bandai Visual of which he became the president of in May of 2003. In 2010, he was succeeded by Ooshita Satoshi, although Kawashiro remained in the company as the vice-president. In April 2012, he was again appointed the president of Bandai Visual.

(Source: AniDB)
